Description: Hamer Californian 1st Gen Korean This is a great playing Hamer Californian 1st Generation Korean from the early 1990s. The 1st Generation Korean Californian is basically a copy of the standard Hamer USA Californian: solid mahogany body and three piece maple neck, but at a budget price instead of the $1500 to $2000 it takes to get a USA version. I now have two of the 1st Gen Californians and they are awesome. While my other Californian was having a fret job, I bought this one as a fixer upper. This one I am selling has: New string tree and and locking nut wedges. New gold whammy bar. New Mojo 500K volume pot. New volume knob with white position indicator. New Dimarzio 3 way selector switch with white or black tip. Dimarzio Virtual Vintage 54 pro DP408 neck pickup - bridge is stock. New Chromacast case with key. New D'Addarrio EXL110: 10-49 strings Two new black allen wrenches: one for the Floyd Rose and one for the volume knob. This Californian is now an 8.0 out of 10. Neck and body are in good condition with a few finish nicks and swirls. I am looking to cover my cost of the guitar and the upgrades. Asking price is $275, but I will accept a reasonable offer. This is a no return sale so ask any questions prior to bidding. Flat shipping of $150. Please email me for quotes to other destinations.
Title: Hamer Californian 1st Gen Korean
ConditionDescription: Guitar is an 8 out of 10.  Case is new.
